REST API repository Auth#

REST API repository Users#

Users Repository Module

This module provides database operations for managing users in the application.

Dependencies:

  • SQLAlchemy for database interactions

  • Logging for error tracking

  • Application-specific schemas, models, and authentication utilities

Functions:

  • get_user: Retrieve a user by ID

  • get_user_by_email: Retrieve a user by email

  • create_user: Create a new user

  • verify_user: Mark a user as verified

  • update_verification_token: Update a user’s verification token

  • update_reset_token: Update a user’s password reset token

  • clear_reset_token: Clear a user’s password reset token

  • update_user_avatar: Update a user’s avatar URL

  • update_password: Update a user’s password

  • delete_user: Delete a user and their associated contacts

Clear a user’s password reset token.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database session

  • email (str) – Email of the user

Returns:

Updated User object if found, else None

Return type:

User or None

Create a new user.

Parameters:

  • user (UserCreate) – User data

  • verification_token (str) – Token for email verification

Returns:

Created User object

Return type:

User

src.repository.users.delete_user(db: Session, user_id: str)[source]#

Delete a user and their associated contacts.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database session

  • user_id (str) – ID of the user to delete

Returns:

True if user was deleted, False if user was not found

Return type:

bool

Raises:

Exception – If there’s an error during the deletion process

REST API repository Contacts#

Contacts Repository Module

This module provides database operations for managing contacts in the application.

Dependencies:

  • SQLAlchemy for database interactions

  • Logging for error tracking

  • Application-specific schemas and models

Functions:

  • get_contacts: Retrieve contacts for a user

  • create_contact: Create a new contact

  • get_contact: Retrieve a specific contact

  • update_contact: Update an existing contact

  • delete_contact: Delete a contact

  • search_contacts: Search for contacts

  • get_upcoming_birthdays: Retrieve contacts with upcoming birthdays

Create a new contact for a user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database session

  • contact (ContactCreate) – Contact data

  • user_id (str) – ID of the user creating the contact

Returns:

Return type:

Contact

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user whose contacts to retrieve

  • skip (int) – Number of records to skip (for pagination)

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of records to return

Return type:

list

REST API routers Auth#

REST API routers Contacts#

Contacts Management Endpoints

This module provides CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations and additional features for managing user contacts in a FastAPI application.

Dependencies:

  • FastAPI modules for routing, dependency injection, and request/response handling.

  • SQLAlchemy for database interactions.

  • Custom repositories for contact-related database operations.

  • Utilities for rate-limiting requests.

Routes:

  • POST /contacts/: Create a new contact.

  • GET /contacts/: Retrieve all contacts with optional pagination.

  • GET /contacts/{contact_id}: Retrieve details of a specific contact.

  • PUT /contacts/{contact_id}: Update a contact’s details.

  • DELETE /contacts/{contact_id}: Delete a specific contact.

  • GET /contacts/search: Search contacts by a query string.

  • GET /contacts/upcoming-birthdays: Retrieve contacts with upcoming birthdays within a specified number of days.

src.routers.contacts.create_contact(request: Request, contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(require_verified_user))[source]#

Create a new contact for the current user.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The data for the new contact.

  • db (Session) – Database session used to create the contact.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated and verified user.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

src.routers.contacts.delete_contact(request: Request, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(require_verified_user))[source]#

Delete a specific contact.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db (Session) – Database session used to delete the contact.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated and verified user.

Returns:

The deleted contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

src.routers.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(request: Request, days: int = Query(7), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]#

Retrieve contacts with upcoming birthdays within the specified number of days.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • days (int) – The number of days to look ahead for upcoming birthdays (default: 7).

  • db (Session) – Database session used to query contacts.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[ContactOut]

src.routers.contacts.read_contact(request: Request, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(require_verified_user))[source]#

Retrieve details of a specific contact.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – Database session used to query the contact.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated and verified user.

Returns:

The requested contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

src.routers.contacts.read_contacts(request: Request, skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(require_verified_user))[source]#

Retrieve all contacts for the current user, with optional pagination.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • skip (int) – The number of records to skip (default: 0).

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of records to return (default: 100).

  • db (Session) – Database session used to query the contacts.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated and verified user.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[ContactOut]

src.routers.contacts.search_contact(request: Request, query: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]#

Search contacts by a query string.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • query (str) – The search string to filter contacts.

  • db (Session) – Database session used to search contacts.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

A list of contacts matching the search query.

Return type:

List[ContactOut]

src.routers.contacts.update_contact(request: Request, contact_id: int, contact: ContactCreate, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(require_verified_user))[source]#

Update a specific contact’s details.

Parameters:

  • request (Request) – The HTTP request object.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • contact (ContactCreate) – The updated contact data.

  • db (Session) – Database session used to update the contact.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated and verified user.

Returns:

The updated contact.

Return type:

ContactOut

Raises:

HTTPException – If the contact is not found.

REST API services Email#

Email Service Module

This module provides functionality for sending verification and password reset emails.

Dependencies:

  • os: For environment variable access

  • logging: For logging information and errors

  • dotenv: For loading environment variables

  • pydantic: For email validation

  • fastapi_mail: For email sending functionality

  • jinja2: For email template rendering

Functions:

  • validate_email_config: Validate required email configuration variables

  • send_verification_email: Send a verification email to a user

  • send_password_reset_email: Send a password reset email to a user

Configuration:

  • Loads email configuration from environment variables

  • Sets up Jinja2 environment for email templates

async src.services.email.send_password_reset_email(email: EmailStr, token: str)[source]#

Send a password reset email to the user.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address

  • token (str) – The password reset token

Raises:

Exception – If there’s an error sending the email

async src.services.email.send_verification_email(email: EmailStr, token: str)[source]#

Send a verification email to the user.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address

  • token (str) – The verification token

Raises:

Exception – If there’s an error sending the email

src.services.email.validate_email_config()[source]#

Validate that all required email configuration variables are set.

Raises:

ValueError – If any required configuration variable is missing

REST API services Cloudinary#

Cloudinary Service Module

This module provides functionality for uploading images to Cloudinary.

Dependencies:

  • os: For environment variable access

  • cloudinary: For Cloudinary API interactions

  • fastapi: For handling file uploads

  • dotenv: For loading environment variables

Functions:

  • upload_image: Upload an image file to Cloudinary

Configuration:

  • Loads Cloudinary configuration from environment variables

src.services.cloudinary.upload_image(file: UploadFile) → str[source]#

Upload an image file to Cloudinary.

Parameters:

file (UploadFile) – The image file to upload

Returns:

The secure URL of the uploaded image

Return type:

str

Raises:

Exception – If there’s an error uploading the image
